34#include <sys/cdefs.h>
35#include <sys/proc.h>
36#include <sys/param.h>
37#include <sys/cpu.h>
38#include <sys/module.h>
39#include <sys/kmem.h>
40
41#include <sys/dtrace.h>
42
43#if 1
44#include <machine/cpufunc.h>
45#include <machine/specialreg.h>
46#if 0
47#include <x86/cpuvar.h>
48#endif
49#include <x86/cputypes.h>
50#endif
51
52#include "fbt.h"
53
54#define FBT_PUSHL_EBP 0x55
55#define FBT_MOVL_ESP_EBP0_V0 0x8b
56#define FBT_MOVL_ESP_EBP1_V0 0xec
57#define FBT_MOVL_ESP_EBP0_V1 0x89
58#define FBT_MOVL_ESP_EBP1_V1 0xe5
59#define FBT_REX_RSP_RBP 0x48
60
61#define FBT_POPL_EBP 0x5d
62#define FBT_RET 0xc3
63#define FBT_RET_IMM16 0xc2
64#define FBT_LEAVE 0xc9
65
66#ifdef __amd64__
67#define FBT_PATCHVAL 0xcc
68#else
69#define FBT_PATCHVAL 0xf0
70#endif
71
72#define FBT_ENTRY "entry"
73#define FBT_RETURN "return"
74
75int
76fbt_invop(uintptr_t addr, struct trapframe *frame, uintptr_t rval)
77{
78 solaris_cpu_t *cpu;
79 uintptr_t *stack;
80 uintptr_t arg0, arg1, arg2, arg3, arg4;
81 fbt_probe_t *fbt;
82
83#ifdef __amd64__
84 stack = (uintptr_t *)frame->tf_rsp;
85#else
86 /* Skip hardware-saved registers. */
87#ifdef __NetBSD__
88 stack = (uintptr_t *)&frame->tf_esp;
89#else
90 stack = (uintptr_t *)frame->tf_isp + 3;
91#endif
92#endif
93
94 cpu = &solaris_cpu[cpu_number()];
95 fbt = fbt_probetab[FBT_ADDR2NDX(addr)];
96 for (; fbt != NULL; fbt = fbt->fbtp_hashnext) {
97 if ((uintptr_t)fbt->fbtp_patchpoint == addr) {
98 if (fbt->fbtp_roffset == 0) {
99#ifdef __amd64__
100 /* fbt->fbtp_rval == DTRACE_INVOP_PUSHQ_RBP */
101 DTRACE_CPUFLAG_SET(CPU_DTRACE_NOFAULT);
102 cpu->cpu_dtrace_caller = stack[0];
103 DTRACE_CPUFLAG_CLEAR(CPU_DTRACE_NOFAULT |
104 CPU_DTRACE_BADADDR);
105
106 arg0 = frame->tf_rdi;
107 arg1 = frame->tf_rsi;
108 arg2 = frame->tf_rdx;
109 arg3 = frame->tf_rcx;
110 arg4 = frame->tf_r8;
111#else
112 int i = 0;
113
114 /*
115 * When accessing the arguments on the stack,
116 * we must protect against accessing beyond
117 * the stack. We can safely set NOFAULT here
118 * -- we know that interrupts are already
119 * disabled.
120 */
121 DTRACE_CPUFLAG_SET(CPU_DTRACE_NOFAULT);
122 cpu->cpu_dtrace_caller = stack[i++];
123 arg0 = stack[i++];
124 arg1 = stack[i++];
125 arg2 = stack[i++];
126 arg3 = stack[i++];
127 arg4 = stack[i++];
128 DTRACE_CPUFLAG_CLEAR(CPU_DTRACE_NOFAULT |
129 CPU_DTRACE_BADADDR);
130#endif
131
132 dtrace_probe(fbt->fbtp_id, arg0, arg1,
133 arg2, arg3, arg4);
134
135 cpu->cpu_dtrace_caller = 0;
136 } else {
137#ifdef __amd64__
138 /*
139 * On amd64, we instrument the ret, not the
140 * leave. We therefore need to set the caller
141 * to ensure that the top frame of a stack()
142 * action is correct.
143 */
144 DTRACE_CPUFLAG_SET(CPU_DTRACE_NOFAULT);
145 cpu->cpu_dtrace_caller = stack[0];
146 DTRACE_CPUFLAG_CLEAR(CPU_DTRACE_NOFAULT |
147 CPU_DTRACE_BADADDR);
148#endif
149
150 dtrace_probe(fbt->fbtp_id, fbt->fbtp_roffset,
151 rval, 0, 0, 0);
152 cpu->cpu_dtrace_caller = 0;
153 }
154
155 return (fbt->fbtp_rval);
156 }
157 }
158
159 return (0);
160}
161
162
163
164
165#ifdef __FreeBSD__
166void
167fbt_patch_tracepoint(fbt_probe_t *fbt, fbt_patchval_t val)
168{
169
170 *fbt->fbtp_patchpoint = val;
171}
172#endif
173
174#ifdef __NetBSD__
175void
176fbt_patch_tracepoint(fbt_probe_t *fbt, fbt_patchval_t val)
177{
178 u_long psl;
179 u_long cr0;
180
181 /* Disable interrupts. */
182 psl = x86_read_psl();
183 x86_disable_intr();
184
185 /* Disable write protection in supervisor mode. */
186 cr0 = rcr0();
187 lcr0(cr0 & ~CR0_WP);
188
189 for (; fbt != NULL; fbt = fbt->fbtp_next) {
190 *fbt->fbtp_patchpoint = val;
191 }
192
193 /* Write back and invalidate cache, flush pipelines. */
194 wbinvd();
195 x86_flush();
196 x86_write_psl(psl);
197
198 /* Re-enable write protection. */
199 lcr0(cr0);
200}
201#endif
202
203
204#ifdef __FreeBSD__
205int
206fbt_provide_module_function(linker_file_t lf, int symindx,
207 linker_symval_t *symval, void *opaque)
208#endif
209#ifdef __NetBSD__
210int
211fbt_provide_module_cb(const char *name, int symindx, void *value,
212 uint32_t symsize, int type, void *opaque)
213#endif
214{
215 fbt_probe_t *fbt, *retfbt;
216 u_int8_t *instr, *limit;
217 int j;
218 int size;
219
220#ifdef __FreeBSD_
221 char *modname = opaque;
222 const char *name = symval->name;
223 size_t symsize = symval->size;
224 void *value = symval->value;
225
226 /*
227 * trap_check() is a wrapper for DTrace's fault handler, so we don't
228 * want to be able to instrument it.
229 */
230 if (strcmp(name, "trap_check") == 0)
231 return (0);
232#endif
233#ifdef __NetBSD__
234 struct fbt_ksyms_arg *fka = opaque;
235 modctl_t *mod = fka->fka_mod;
236 const char *modname = module_name(mod);
237
238 /* got a function? */
239 if (ELF_ST_TYPE(type) != STT_FUNC)
240 return 0;
241
242 /*
243 * Exclude some more symbols which can be called from probe context.
244 */
245 if (strcmp(name, "x86_curcpu") == 0 ||
246 strcmp(name, "x86_curlwp") == 0) {
247 return 0;
248 }
249#endif
250
251 if (fbt_excluded(name))
252 return (0);
253
254 instr = (u_int8_t *) value;
255 limit = (u_int8_t *) value + symsize;
256
257#ifdef __amd64__
258 while (instr < limit) {
259 if (*instr == FBT_PUSHL_EBP)
260 break;
261
262 if ((size = dtrace_instr_size(instr)) <= 0)
263 break;
264
265 instr += size;
266 }
267
268 if (instr >= limit || *instr != FBT_PUSHL_EBP) {
269 /*
270 * We either don't save the frame pointer in this
271 * function, or we ran into some disassembly
272 * screw-up. Either way, we bail.
273 */
274 return (0);
275 }
276#else
277 if (instr[0] != FBT_PUSHL_EBP)
278 return (0);
279
280 if (!(instr[1] == FBT_MOVL_ESP_EBP0_V0 &&
281 instr[2] == FBT_MOVL_ESP_EBP1_V0) &&
282 !(instr[1] == FBT_MOVL_ESP_EBP0_V1 &&
283 instr[2] == FBT_MOVL_ESP_EBP1_V1))
284 return (0);
285#endif
286
287 fbt = kmem_zalloc(sizeof (*fbt), KM_SLEEP);
288 fbt->fbtp_name = name;
289 fbt->fbtp_id = dtrace_probe_create(fbt_id, modname,
290 name, FBT_ENTRY, 3, fbt);
291 fbt->fbtp_patchpoint = instr;
292#ifdef __FreeBSD__
293 fbt->fbtp_ctl = lf;
294 fbt->fbtp_loadcnt = lf->loadcnt;
295#endif
296#ifdef __NetBSD__
297 fbt->fbtp_ctl = mod;
298#endif
299 fbt->fbtp_rval = DTRACE_INVOP_PUSHL_EBP;
300 fbt->fbtp_savedval = *instr;
301 fbt->fbtp_patchval = FBT_PATCHVAL;
302 fbt->fbtp_symindx = symindx;
303
304 fbt->fbtp_hashnext = fbt_probetab[FBT_ADDR2NDX(instr)];
305 fbt_probetab[FBT_ADDR2NDX(instr)] = fbt;
306#ifdef __FreeBSD__
307 lf->fbt_nentries++;
308#endif
309
310 retfbt = NULL;
311again:
312 if (instr >= limit)
313 return (0);
314
315 /*
316 * If this disassembly fails, then we've likely walked off into
317 * a jump table or some other unsuitable area. Bail out of the
318 * disassembly now.
319 */
320 if ((size = dtrace_instr_size(instr)) <= 0)
321 return (0);
322
323#ifdef __amd64__
324 /*
325 * We only instrument "ret" on amd64 -- we don't yet instrument
326 * ret imm16, largely because the compiler doesn't seem to
327 * (yet) emit them in the kernel...
328 */
329 if (*instr != FBT_RET) {
330 instr += size;
331 goto again;
332 }
333#else
334 if (!(size == 1 &&
335 (*instr == FBT_POPL_EBP || *instr == FBT_LEAVE) &&
336 (*(instr + 1) == FBT_RET ||
337 *(instr + 1) == FBT_RET_IMM16))) {
338 instr += size;
339 goto again;
340 }
341#endif
342
343 /*
344 * We (desperately) want to avoid erroneously instrumenting a
345 * jump table, especially given that our markers are pretty
346 * short: two bytes on x86, and just one byte on amd64. To
347 * determine if we're looking at a true instruction sequence
348 * or an inline jump table that happens to contain the same
349 * byte sequences, we resort to some heuristic sleeze: we
350 * treat this instruction as being contained within a pointer,
351 * and see if that pointer points to within the body of the
352 * function. If it does, we refuse to instrument it.
353 */
354 for (j = 0; j < sizeof (uintptr_t); j++) {
355 caddr_t check = (caddr_t) instr - j;
356 uint8_t *ptr;
357
358 if (check < (caddr_t)value)
359 break;
360
361 if (check + sizeof (caddr_t) > (caddr_t)limit)
362 continue;
363
364 ptr = *(uint8_t **)check;
365
366 if (ptr >= (uint8_t *) value && ptr < limit) {
367 instr += size;
368 goto again;
369 }
370 }
371
372 /*
373 * We have a winner!
374 */
375 fbt = kmem_zalloc(sizeof (*fbt), KM_SLEEP);
376 fbt->fbtp_name = name;
377
378 if (retfbt == NULL) {
379 fbt->fbtp_id = dtrace_probe_create(fbt_id, modname,
380 name, FBT_RETURN, 3, fbt);
381 } else {
382 retfbt->fbtp_next = fbt;
383 fbt->fbtp_id = retfbt->fbtp_id;
384 }
385
386 retfbt = fbt;
387 fbt->fbtp_patchpoint = instr;
388#ifdef __FreeBSD__
389 fbt->fbtp_ctl = lf;
390 fbt->fbtp_loadcnt = lf->loadcnt;
391#endif
392#ifdef __NetBSD__
393 fbt->fbtp_ctl = mod;
394#endif
395 fbt->fbtp_symindx = symindx;
396
397#ifndef __amd64__
398 if (*instr == FBT_POPL_EBP) {
399 fbt->fbtp_rval = DTRACE_INVOP_POPL_EBP;
400 } else {
401 ASSERT(*instr == FBT_LEAVE);
402 fbt->fbtp_rval = DTRACE_INVOP_LEAVE;
403 }
404 fbt->fbtp_roffset =
405 (uintptr_t)(instr - (uint8_t *) value) + 1;
406
407#else
408 ASSERT(*instr == FBT_RET);
409 fbt->fbtp_rval = DTRACE_INVOP_RET;
410 fbt->fbtp_roffset =
411 (uintptr_t)(instr - (uint8_t *) value);
412#endif
413
414 fbt->fbtp_savedval = *instr;
415 fbt->fbtp_patchval = FBT_PATCHVAL;
416 fbt->fbtp_hashnext = fbt_probetab[FBT_ADDR2NDX(instr)];
417 fbt_probetab[FBT_ADDR2NDX(instr)] = fbt;
418
419#ifdef __FreeBSD__
420 lf->fbt_nentries++;
421#endif
422
423 instr += size;
424 goto again;
425}
